This sketch will consist of a single face (face\\_1) with a closed loop (loop\\_1) made up of the following linear and curved segments: * line\\_1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.0644, 0.0) * line\\_2: Start Point (0.0644, 0.0), End Point (0.0644, 0.0644) * line\\_3: Start Point (0.0644, 0.0644), End Point (0.051, 0.0644) * line\\_4: Start Point (0.051, 0.0644), End Point (0.051, 0.0134) * line\\_5: Start Point (0.051, 0.0134), End Point (0.0134, 0.0134) * line\\_6: Start Point (0.0134, 0.0134), End Point (0.0134, 0.0644) * line\\_7: Start Point (0.0134, 0.0644), End Point (0.0, 0.0644) * line\\_8: Start Point (0.0, 0.0644), End Point (0.0, 0.0) The loop is closed since line\\_8 ends at the same point where line\\_1 starts. Now, scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale parameter (0.0644). Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along its normal vector to a depth of 0.1875 units and in the opposite direction of the normal vector to a depth of 0.1875 units, creating the final 3D model. The dimensions of the final shape are: * Length: 0.0644 * Width: 0.375 * Height: 0.0644</description>

The loop should consist of four straight lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) with the following start and end points: - line\\_1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - line\\_2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.75) - line\\_3: (0.75, 0.75) to (0.0, 0.75) - line\\_4: (0.0, 0.75) to (0.0, 0.0) Scale the 2D sketch created in the previous step by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system.
